extensionDescription.message: Extracts attachments from messages under the selected folder or account.

extractSingleDescription.message: Extracts attachments from the selected folder, omitting sub-folders
extractSingleDescription.description: Action description for extract-single QuickMenu button

extractRecursiveDescription.message: Extracts attachments from the selected folders and sub-folders (recursive)
extractRecursiveDescription.description: Action description for extract-recursive QuickMenu button

standardSelectionDescription.message: Allows you to choose specific folders, or even specific attachments for discovery and extraction
standardSelectionDescription.description: Action description for standard-selection QuickMenu button

noAttachmentsMessage.message: There are no attachments in the selected folder.

noMessagesMessage.message: There are no messages in the selected folder.

discoveryProgressMessage.description: {# of discovered} attachment(s) in {# of messages including attachments/embeds)} of {total # of discovered messages}

discoverySelectionMessage.description: {# of selected} of {# of discovered} attachment(s) selected

embedDiscoverySelectionMessage.description: {# of selected} of {# of discovered} embed(s) selected

alterationsIdentified.description: Regards attachments which were detached or deleted from the (altered) source message.

of.description: Used in the sense of 'x items out of y total items'

imapDetachUnavailable.message: This feature is currently unavaialble for IMAP accounts.

permanentDetachWarning.message: WARNING: This action will permanently remove the extracted attachments (and duplicates) from their source email messages. Embeds are excluded.

useInteractiveUiDescription.message: Fully interactive UI; allows for selection of specific attachments to extract

displayQuickMenuDescription.message: Displays a shortcut menu when Extract 'Em! is opened

extractImmediateDescription.message: Saves all attachments from messages in the selected folder with limited user intervention; excludes sub-folders

alwaysPromptForDownloadLocationMessage.message: If checked, the user is always prompted to select a save directory; otherwise, files are directly saved to the folder specified in the Thunderbird settings

includeSubFoldersDescription.message: Includes attachments in subfolders during immediate extraction

useSilentModeDescription.message: Omits UI presentation, with the exception of the save prompt

useFilenamePattern.description: Option to replace the original attachment filename with one constructed from message attributes

useFilenamePatternDescription.message: Replaces the original attachment filename with one constructed from message attributes

timestamp.description: h = hour, m = minute, s= second; implies a time format (154230 = 3:42:30 PM)

includeEmbeddedImagesDescription.message: Identifies and includes images embedded in the message body (inline images)

useFileTypeFilterDescription.message: Limits results to selected file types, specified by extension (.jpg, .mp3, .mov, etc.)

omitDuplicatesDescription.message: Omits duplicate (identical filename and size) attachments; does not pertain to embeds

preserveFolderStructureDescription.message: Stores the attachments in the .zip archive in the same folders they reside under in Thunderbird

useEnhancedLoggingDescription.message: Outputs additional troubleshooting information to the debugger console

defaultGroupingDescription.message: Groups items in the Attachment List according to the specified attribute

imagePreviewDescription.message: Specifies the size of the Preview Image for items in the Attachment List

unlistedFileTypes.message: All file types not listed above

addTypeMessage.message: Enter a 3-5 character file extension (txt, csv, etc).

missingAttachment.message: Attachment has no data; presumed deleted/detached.

detachErrorMessage.message: One or more attachments failed to detach.

rn1_2_1_Notice01.message: NOTICE: If you used version 1.1.4 of this extension (available between approximately April 10 and April 23, 2024) any archive files you produced are likely to be corrupt.

rn1_2_1_Notice02.message: This was due to an improper configuration of the 3rd-party code library (zip.js) used to generate the archive.

rn1_2_1_Notice03.message: The author of this extension wished to express his sincerest apologies to any users who may have been inconvenienced by this issue.

rn1_2_1_New01.message: Added option for extracting embedded (inline-attached) images

rn1_2_1_New02.message: Added new version notification (automatic display of Release Notes) upon new version release

rn1_2_1_New03.message: Added permanent detach option (Thunderbird version 123 or later required)

rn1_2_1_New04.message: Added identification of detached and deleted attachments

rn1_2_1_Fix01.message: Removed recursive extraction (extracting attachments within email [.eml] files which themselves are attachments)

rn1_2_1_Fix02.message: Switched to zip.js library (from jszip) to mitigate an intermittent memory issue

rn1_3_1_New01.message: Added the ability to generate/save an extraction report (.html) following execution

rn1_3_1_New02.message: Added localization for Hungarian (courtesy of user Óvári)

rn1_4_1_New01.message: Added option to generate custom result filenames using a filename pattern derived from email properties

rn1_5_1_Notice01.message: NOTICE: The Permanently Detach feature currently fails/stalls when used with IMAP accounts. For details, please click the following link.

rn1_5_1_New01.message: Added option for filtering by file type (extension)

rn1_5_1_New02.message: Added toggle-all checkbox for attachment selection (Attachment List)

rn1_5_1_New03.message: Added option for always prompting for a save location for package files, or directly saving to the directory specified by the respective Thunderbird setting

rn1_5_2_New01.message: Permanently Detach button disabled for IMAP accounts until further notice.

packageAttachmentsDesc.message: Stores extracted items in archive (.zip) files

directSaveDesc.message: Items are individually saved to the folder specified in the Thunderbird settings
